Original: Original
Dialogue: Dialogue

Original: VICKS:There's the town...
Dialogue: There's the town...

Original: WEDGE:Hard to believe an Esper's been found intact there, 1000 years after the War of the Magi...
Dialogue: Hard to believe an Esper's been found intact there, 1000 years after the War of the Magi...

Original: VICKS:Think it's still alive?
Dialogue: Think it's still alive?

Original: WEDGE:Probably... ...judging from the urgency of our orders.
Dialogue: Probably... ...judging from the urgency of our orders.

Original: VICKS:And this woman, this...sorcerer. Why's she here? I heard she fried 50 of our Magitek Armored soldiers in under 3 minutes.
Dialogue: And this woman, this...sorcerer. Why's she here? I heard she fried 50 of our Magitek Armored soldiers in under 3 minutes.

Original: WEDGE:Not to worry. The Slave Crown on her head robs her of all conscious thought. She'll follow orders.
Dialogue: Not to worry. The Slave Crown on her head robs her of all conscious thought. She'll follow orders.

Original: WEDGE:We'll approach from the east. Move out!
Dialogue: We'll approach from the east. Move out!

Original: WEDGE:Let's put her on point. No sense taking any risks. Forward!
Dialogue: Let's put her on point. No sense taking any risks. Forward!

Original: GUARD:Imperial Magitek Armor? Not even Narshe's safe anymore!
Dialogue: Imperial Magitek Armor? Not even Narshe's safe anymore!

Original: GUARD:Machine-riding, self-important swine! Take this!
Dialogue: Machine-riding, self-important swine! Take this!

Original: GUARD:Narshe's freedom depends on us!
Dialogue: Narshe's freedom depends on us!

Original: WEDGE:According to our source, the frozen Esper was found in a new mine shaft. ...Maybe this one...
Dialogue: According to our source, the frozen Esper was found in a new mine shaft. ...Maybe this one...

Original: VICKS:I'll handle this. Stand back!
Dialogue: I'll handle this. Stand back!

Original: GUARD:We've got 'em trapped, now!
Dialogue: We've got 'em trapped, now!

Original: GUARD:We must defend the mines!
Dialogue: We must defend the mines!

Original: GUARD:We won't hand over the Esper!! Whelk! Get them!
Dialogue: We won't hand over the Esper!! Whelk! Get them!

Original: VICKS:Hold it! Think back to our briefing......
Dialogue: Hold it! Think back to our briefing......

Original: WEDGE:What about it?!
Dialogue: What about it?!

Original: VICKS:Do you recall hearing about a monster that eats lightning......
Dialogue: Do you recall hearing about a monster that eats lightning......

Original: WEDGE:......and stores the energy in its shell!
Dialogue: ......and stores the energy in its shell!

Original: VICKS:Right. So whatever you do, don't attack the shell!
Dialogue: Right. So whatever you do, don't attack the shell!

Original: WEDGE:Alright already!
Dialogue: Alright already!

Original: WEDGE:Hey! What's the matter? Do you know something we don't......?
Dialogue: Hey! What's the matter? Do you know something we don't......?

Original: WEDGE:Where's that light coming from?! Uwaaaaaaa!!!!
Dialogue: Where's that light coming from?! Uwaaaaaaa!!!!

Original: VICKS:Hey! Wedge......where are you? W......what's happening?!
Dialogue: Hey! Wedge......where are you? W......what's happening?!

Original: GIRL:Where am I...?
Dialogue: Where am I...?

Original: OLD MAN:Whoa! And I only just removed the crown!
Dialogue: Whoa! And I only just removed the crown!

Original: OLD MAN:Easy! This is a Slave Crown. The others had complete control over you while you were wearing it.
Dialogue: Easy! This is a Slave Crown. The others had complete control over you while you were wearing it.

Original: GIRL:I can't remember a thing...
Dialogue: I can't remember a thing...

Original: OLD MAN:Don't worry. It'll all come back to you...in time, that is.
Dialogue: Don't worry. It'll all come back to you...in time, that is.

Original: OLD MAN:Impressive! I've never heard of anyone recovering this fast...!
Dialogue: Impressive! I've never heard of anyone recovering this fast...!

Original: SOLDIER:Open up! Give us back the girl and the Empire's Magitek Armor!!
Dialogue: Open up! Give us back the girl and the Empire's Magitek Armor!!

Original: SOLDIER:Open this door! We want that girl! She's an officer of the Empire!
Dialogue: Open this door! We want that girl! She's an officer of the Empire!

Original: TERRA:Empire...? Magitek Armor...?
Dialogue: Empire...? Magitek Armor...?

Original: OLD MAN:Look, I have to get you out of here! I don't have time to explain!
Dialogue: Look, I have to get you out of here! I don't have time to explain!

Original: OLD MAN:Over here!
Dialogue: Over here!

Original: OLD MAN:Make your way out through the mines! I'll keep these brutes occupied!
Dialogue: Make your way out through the mines! I'll keep these brutes occupied!

Original: KEFKA:My sweet little magic user...! Uweee, he, he! With this Slave Crown I'll practically OWN you!!
Dialogue: My sweet little magic user...! Uweee, he, he! With this Slave Crown I'll practically OWN you!!

Original: KEFKA:Uwee, hee, hee! Good! Burn up everything!
Dialogue: Uwee, hee, hee! Good! Burn up everything!

Original: GESTAHL:We stand on the brink of a major breakthrough! In the days to come, we'll witness a total revival of magic!
Dialogue: We stand on the brink of a major breakthrough! In the days to come, we'll witness a total revival of magic!

Original: GESTAHL:It is our destiny, and ours alone, to take this mystic force and claim what is rightfully ours!
Dialogue: It is our destiny, and ours alone, to take this mystic force and claim what is rightfully ours!

Original: GESTAHL:With our new-found power, nothing can stand in our way!
Dialogue: With our new-found power, nothing can stand in our way!

Original: OLD MAN:Took you long enough! How goes the robbing and plundering trade?
Dialogue: Took you long enough! How goes the robbing and plundering trade?

Original: LOCKE:I PREFER the term treasure hunting!
Dialogue: I PREFER the term treasure hunting!

Original: OLD MAN:Ha! Semantic nonsense!
Dialogue: Ha! Semantic nonsense!

Original: LOCKE:There's a HUGE difference!
Dialogue: There's a HUGE difference!

Original: LOCKE:Anyway, were you the one who sent for me?
Dialogue: Anyway, were you the one who sent for me?

Original: OLD MAN:Yeah. There's a girl I'd like you to meet.
Dialogue: Yeah. There's a girl I'd like you to meet.

Original: LOCKE:......!? This better not have anything to do with that Magitek-riding, imperial...witch!!!
Dialogue: ......!? This better not have anything to do with that Magitek-riding, imperial...witch!!!

Original: OLD MAN:Imperial troops are pursuing her even as we speak. This town is no match for the Empire. Our independence can only be assured if we join forces with the Returners, an underground resistance movement. That girl wasn't responsible for her actions. We must get her to understand our dilemma!
Dialogue: Imperial troops are pursuing her even as we speak. This town is no match for the Empire. Our independence can only be assured if we join forces with the Returners, an underground resistance movement. That girl wasn't responsible for her actions. We must get her to understand our dilemma!

Original: LOCKE:All right... I think we'd better help her...
Dialogue: All right... I think we'd better help her...

Original: OLD MAN:Agreed. Make your way first to Figaro, and talk to the king.
Dialogue: Agreed. Make your way first to Figaro, and talk to the king.

Original: GUARD:Now we gotcha!
Dialogue: Now we gotcha!

Original: LOCKE:Wonderful... There's a whole bunch of 'em...
Dialogue: Wonderful... There's a whole bunch of 'em...

Original: LOCKE:Moogles...! Are you saying you want to help me?
Dialogue: Moogles...! Are you saying you want to help me?

Original: MOOGLE:Use us to save Terra from the guards! Need more information?
Dialogue: Use us to save Terra from the guards! Need more information?

Original: LOCKE:Thanks, Moogles! We're in your debt!
Dialogue: Thanks, Moogles! We're in your debt!

Original: LOCKE:I think this switch'll...
Dialogue: I think this switch'll...

Original: LOCKE:Eh? You back with us now?!
Dialogue: Eh? You back with us now?!

Original: TERRA:You...saved me?
Dialogue: You...saved me?

Original: LOCKE:Save your thanks for the Moogles!
Dialogue: Save your thanks for the Moogles!

Original: TERRA:Uhh...I can't remember anything...past or present...
Dialogue: Uhh...I can't remember anything...past or present...

Original: LOCKE:You have amnesia?!
Dialogue: You have amnesia?!

Original: TERRA:A man said my memory would come back...
Dialogue: A man said my memory would come back...

Original: LOCKE:Give it time. You're safe with me! I give you my word!
Dialogue: Give it time. You're safe with me! I give you my word!

Original: LOCKE:I won't leave you until your memory returns!! By the way, this secret entrance might be useful some day. Don't forget about it!
Dialogue: I won't leave you until your memory returns!! By the way, this secret entrance might be useful some day. Don't forget about it!

Original: MAN:You mean, THIS young woman...?!
Dialogue: You mean, THIS young woman...?!

Original: TERRA:Who do you think you are?
Dialogue: Who do you think you are?

Original: MAN:How rude of me to turn my back to a lady!
Dialogue: How rude of me to turn my back to a lady!

Original: EDGAR:I am Edgar, King of Figaro.LOCKE:Surprised someone like me knows a king?
Dialogue: I am Edgar, King of Figaro. LOCKE Surprised someone like me knows a king?

Original: LOCKE:Talk to you later!
Dialogue: Talk to you later!

Original: EDGAR:So...you're an Imperial soldier! No problem. Figaro and the Empire are allies! Please, relax while you're here. It's not in my blood to harm a lady.
Dialogue: So...you're an Imperial soldier! No problem. Figaro and the Empire are allies! Please, relax while you're here. It's not in my blood to harm a lady.

Original: TERRA:Look, why are you helping me? Is it because of my...abilities?
Dialogue: Look, why are you helping me? Is it because of my...abilities?

Original: EDGAR:I'll give you 3 reasons: First of all, your beauty has captivated me! Second...I'm dying to know if I'm your type...
Dialogue: I'll give you 3 reasons First of all, your beauty has captivated me! Second...I'm dying to know if I'm your type...

Original: TERRA:......? What's with you, anyway?
Dialogue: ......? What's with you, anyway?

Original: EDGAR:Guess my technique's getting a bit rusty...
Dialogue: Guess my technique's getting a bit rusty...

Original: TERRA:Hmm...I suppose a normal girl would have found him dashing. But I'm hardly...normal...
Dialogue: Hmm...I suppose a normal girl would have found him dashing. But I'm hardly...normal...

Original: MATRON:Edgar has a twin brother. He was such a nice boy...
Dialogue: Edgar has a twin brother. He was such a nice boy...

Original: YOUTH:Brother, What's wrong with father? What's all this talk of his successor?
Dialogue: Brother, What's wrong with father? What's all this talk of his successor?

Original: EDGAR:Are you blind? Look how thin his face has become!
Dialogue: Are you blind? Look how thin his face has become!

Original: YOUTH:?......What is it?
Dialogue: ?......What is it?

Original: MATRON:Yes... His name is Sabin. Oh, he looked so like his father! When he ran away, he was a sweet little child. I wonder what he's like now?
Dialogue: Yes... His name is Sabin. Oh, he looked so like his father! When he ran away, he was a sweet little child. I wonder what he's like now?

Original: EDGAR:Well? How do you like my castle?
Dialogue: Well? How do you like my castle?

Original: EDGAR:Probably Kefka!
Dialogue: Probably Kefka!

Original: KEFKA:Phooey! Emperor Gestahl's stupid orders!
Dialogue: Phooey! Emperor Gestahl's stupid orders!

Original: KEFKA:Edgar, you pinhead! Why do you have to live in the middle of nowhere? These recon jobs are the pits!
Dialogue: Edgar, you pinhead! Why do you have to live in the middle of nowhere? These recon jobs are the pits!

Original: KEFKA:Ahem...there's SAND on my boots!
Dialogue: Ahem...there's SAND on my boots!

Original: SOLDIERS:Yes, Sir! All set, Sir!
Dialogue: Yes, Sir! All set, Sir!

Original: KEFKA:Outta my way!
Dialogue: Outta my way!

Original: EDGAR:What brings Kefka, humble servant of Emperor Gestahl, into our lowly presence?
Dialogue: What brings Kefka, humble servant of Emperor Gestahl, into our lowly presence?

Original: KEFKA:A girl of no importance recently escaped from us. We heard she found refuge here...
Dialogue: A girl of no importance recently escaped from us. We heard she found refuge here...

Original: EDGAR:Hmm...this wouldn't have anything to do with this "witch" everyone's been whispering about, would it?
Dialogue: Hmm...this wouldn't have anything to do with this "witch" everyone's been whispering about, would it?

Original: KEFKA:Lies! She...merely stole something of minor value. Is she here?
Dialogue: Lies! She...merely stole something of minor value. Is she here?

Original: EDGAR:That's a tough one!
Dialogue: That's a tough one!

Original: EDGAR:You see, there're more girls here than grains of sand out there. I can't keep track of 'em all!
Dialogue: You see, there're more girls here than grains of sand out there. I can't keep track of 'em all!

Original: KEFKA:I'd hate to be you if we find out you're lying... Mwa, ha!
Dialogue: I'd hate to be you if we find out you're lying... Mwa, ha!

Original: KEFKA:I truly hope nothing happens to your precious Figaro...!
Dialogue: I truly hope nothing happens to your precious Figaro...!

Original: LOCKE:I'd say that guy's missing a few buttons...EDGAR:...Where's Terra?
Dialogue: I'd say that guy's missing a few buttons... EDGAR ...Where's Terra?

Original: EDGAR:Take her to her room...
Dialogue: Take her to her room...

Original: EDGAR:I'd love to chat with you, but the Chancellor and I must plan our strategy. Sometimes I hate being a king! If you'll excuse me.
Dialogue: I'd love to chat with you, but the Chancellor and I must plan our strategy. Sometimes I hate being a king! If you'll excuse me.

Original: LOCKE:Follow me.
Dialogue: Follow me.

Original: LOCKE:Don't you worry 'bout a thing! I'll...
Dialogue: Don't you worry 'bout a thing! I'll...

Original: TERRA:You're Locke, right? Edgar told me about you. Is it true you're a thief?
Dialogue: You're Locke, right? Edgar told me about you. Is it true you're a thief?

Original: LOCKE:That's TREASURE HUNTER!
Dialogue: That's TREASURE HUNTER!

Original: LOCKE:On the surface, Edgar pretends to support the Empire. The truth is, he's collaborating with the Returners, an organization opposed to the Empire. I am his contact with that group...
Dialogue: On the surface, Edgar pretends to support the Empire. The truth is, he's collaborating with the Returners, an organization opposed to the Empire. I am his contact with that group...

Original: LOCKE:The old man you met in Narshe is one of us.
Dialogue: The old man you met in Narshe is one of us.

Original: TERRA:Empire...but I'm a soldier of the Empire...!
Dialogue: Empire...but I'm a soldier of the Empire...!

Original: LOCKE:That's not true! They were using you! Things are different now.
Dialogue: That's not true! They were using you! Things are different now.

Original: TERRA:I don't understand... What should I do?
Dialogue: I don't understand... What should I do?

Original: LOCKE:I can't tell you what to do. You don't have to decide right now. You'll soon find your way...
Dialogue: I can't tell you what to do. You don't have to decide right now. You'll soon find your way...

Original: TERRA:But how will I know which way is right...
Dialogue: But how will I know which way is right...

Original: EDGAR:...? What the...?!
Dialogue: ...? What the...?!

Original: EDGAR:What's happening?
Dialogue: What's happening?

Original: SOLDIER:It's the Empire! It's Kefka!
Dialogue: It's the Empire! It's Kefka!

Original: EDGAR:What are you doing?
Dialogue: What are you doing?

Original: KEFKA:Bring me the girl. Now!
Dialogue: Bring me the girl. Now!

Original: EDGAR:I don't know what you're talking about!
Dialogue: I don't know what you're talking about!

Original: KEFKA:Then... welcome to my barbecue!! Uwa ha ha ha!
Dialogue: Then... welcome to my barbecue!! Uwa ha ha ha!

Original: EDGAR:Get ready...!
Dialogue: Get ready...!

Original: SOLDIER:Yes, Sir!
Dialogue: Yes, Sir!

Original: KEFKA:Changed your mind...?
Dialogue: Changed your mind...?

Original: EDGAR:I guess I have no choice...
Dialogue: I guess I have no choice...

Original: EDGAR:Or maybe I do!
Dialogue: Or maybe I do!

Original: KEFKA:Ackk! Shameful that a king should flee, leaving his people behind! How utterly delightful!
Dialogue: Ackk! Shameful that a king should flee, leaving his people behind! How utterly delightful!

Original: EDGAR:OK! Dive now!!!
Dialogue: OK! Dive now!!!

Original: SOLDIER:Figaro Submerge Mode engaged!
Dialogue: Figaro Submerge Mode engaged!

Original: CHANCELLOR:No one can touch the people of Figaro!
Dialogue: No one can touch the people of Figaro!

Original: KEFKA:Go!! GET THEM!
Dialogue: Go!! GET THEM!

Original: EDGAR:Bravo, Figaro!!!
Dialogue: Bravo, Figaro!!!

Original: KEFKA:Son of a submariner! They'll pay for this...
Dialogue: Son of a submariner! They'll pay for this...

Original: LOCKE:This is great!
Dialogue: This is great!

Original: TERRA:Was that a bad person? I... I'm scared...
Dialogue: Was that a bad person? I... I'm scared...

Original: EDGAR:Terra, there's someone I'd like you to meet...!
Dialogue: Terra, there's someone I'd like you to meet...!

Original: LOCKE:We're members of the Returners.
Dialogue: We're members of the Returners.

Original: EDGAR:Our mentor, Banon, would certainly like to meet you. "Magic" is going to be the key to winning this war.
Dialogue: Our mentor, Banon, would certainly like to meet you. "Magic" is going to be the key to winning this war.

Original: EDGAR:Terra has magical powers. That Esper seemed to...react to her. Can there be some connection?
Dialogue: Terra has magical powers. That Esper seemed to...react to her. Can there be some connection?

Original: TERRA:I haven't the foggiest! It just seems natural to me that I have the use of this power...
Dialogue: I haven't the foggiest! It just seems natural to me that I have the use of this power...

Original: EDGAR:But no HUMAN is born with the powers you seem to have, and...
Dialogue: But no HUMAN is born with the powers you seem to have, and...

Original: EDGAR:I apologize.
Dialogue: I apologize.

Original: TERRA:What should I do...?
Dialogue: What should I do...?

Original: EDGAR:I'm sure the Empire is going to come after you... If they get their hands on you again, the world's finished... Terra, you want to understand your own powers, right?
Dialogue: I'm sure the Empire is going to come after you... If they get their hands on you again, the world's finished... Terra, you want to understand your own powers, right?

Original: EDGAR:Then I think we need to consult with Banon.
Dialogue: Then I think we need to consult with Banon.

Original: EDGAR:OK! To the south there's a cave that leads to South Figaro.
Dialogue: OK! To the south there's a cave that leads to South Figaro.

Original: SOLDIER:King Edgar! Where are you headed?
Dialogue: King Edgar! Where are you headed?

Original: EDGAR:Through the cave, and eastward to South Figaro.
Dialogue: Through the cave, and eastward to South Figaro.

Original: EDGAR:Return to the castle, and tell the others we're safe.
Dialogue: Return to the castle, and tell the others we're safe.

Original: SOLDIER:Yes, Sir! Take care!
Dialogue: Yes, Sir! Take care!

Original: VARGAS:Sabin sent you, right?
Dialogue: Sabin sent you, right?

Original: LOCKE:Who're YOU?
Dialogue: Who're YOU?

Original: EDGAR:Sabin? Is he here?
Dialogue: Sabin? Is he here?

Original: LOCKE:You were shadowing us earlier, right?
Dialogue: You were shadowing us earlier, right?

Original: VARGAS:And how unlucky it is that you have run into me...!
Dialogue: And how unlucky it is that you have run into me...!

Original: VARGAS:Is that you, Sabin?!
Dialogue: Is that you, Sabin?!

Original: SABIN:Vargas, why'd you do it? How could you do your own father in like that?!
Dialogue: Vargas, why'd you do it? How could you do your own father in like that?!

Original: VARGAS:Fool! He made the mistake of choosing you as his successor! He snubbed me, his only son!
Dialogue: Fool! He made the mistake of choosing you as his successor! He snubbed me, his only son!

Original: SABIN:No! You were the one he chose!
Dialogue: No! You were the one he chose!

Original: VARGAS:You're a liar!
Dialogue: You're a liar!

Original: SABIN:Our Master wanted you to be his successor, not me. He appreciated your fine spirit......
Dialogue: Our Master wanted you to be his successor, not me. He appreciated your fine spirit......

Original: VARGAS:Enough of your lies! Now, have a taste of my superior technique!
Dialogue: Enough of your lies! Now, have a taste of my superior technique!

Original: VARGAS:Mortal Attack! Blizzard Fist!
Dialogue: Mortal Attack! Blizzard Fist!

Original: VARGAS:Ahh, Sabin! The master taught you well!
Dialogue: Ahh, Sabin! The master taught you well!

Original: SABIN:: I guess there's no avoiding this!
Dialogue: guess there's no avoiding this!

Original: VARGAS:Fate made us train together, and fate will send you to your doom!
Dialogue: Fate made us train together, and fate will send you to your doom!

Original: VARGAS:W......what the......?! He......already taught you that?!
Dialogue: W......what the......?! He......already taught you that?!

Original: SABIN:: If only you hadn't been in such a rush for power......
Dialogue: f only you hadn't been in such a rush for power......

Original: SABIN:Big brother?
Dialogue: Big brother?

Original: LOCKE:The brothers are reunited!
Dialogue: The brothers are reunited!

Original: TERRA:Younger... "brother"? At first glance I thought he was some bodybuilder who had strayed from his gym...
Dialogue: Younger... "brother"? At first glance I thought he was some bodybuilder who had strayed from his gym...

Original: SABIN:I'll...take that as a compliment...
Dialogue: I'll...take that as a compliment...

Original: SABIN:Anyway, brother, what are you doing here?
Dialogue: Anyway, brother, what are you doing here?

Original: EDGAR:We're on the way to the Sabil mountains.
Dialogue: We're on the way to the Sabil mountains.

Original: SABIN:To the Returner hideout, no doubt?
Dialogue: To the Returner hideout, no doubt?

Original: SABIN:I've been watching from afar, hoping that the world might regain some sanity... At this rate, Figaro will be reduced to a puppet state.
Dialogue: I've been watching from afar, hoping that the world might regain some sanity... At this rate, Figaro will be reduced to a puppet state.

Original: EDGAR:Our time to strike back has arrived. The Empire's going to pay for what it has done...
Dialogue: Our time to strike back has arrived. The Empire's going to pay for what it has done...

Original: SABIN:Think a "bear" like me could help you in your fight?
Dialogue: Think a "bear" like me could help you in your fight?

Original: EDGAR:You'd...join us? Sabin...!!
Dialogue: You'd...join us? Sabin...!!

Original: SABIN:I think Duncan would rest easier if he knew his disciple played a part in bringing peace to the world.
Dialogue: I think Duncan would rest easier if he knew his disciple played a part in bringing peace to the world.

Original: LOCKE:Let's get going!
Dialogue: Let's get going!

Original: EDGAR:Banon! We brought the girl with us.
Dialogue: Banon! We brought the girl with us.

Original: BANON:Is she the girl who can talk to Espers...?!
Dialogue: Is she the girl who can talk to Espers...?!

Original: EDGAR:Seemed the Empire had complete control over her.
Dialogue: Seemed the Empire had complete control over her.

Original: BANON:Carrier pigeons brought word that she wiped out 50 of the Empire's best soldiers in a few minutes.
Dialogue: Carrier pigeons brought word that she wiped out 50 of the Empire's best soldiers in a few minutes.

Original: TERRA:That's a lie!!!
Dialogue: That's a lie!!!

Original: EDGAR:Banon! She doesn't remember ANYTHING!
Dialogue: Banon! She doesn't remember ANYTHING!

Original: BANON:Stay where you are! Perhaps you've heard this story? Once, when people were pure and innocent, there was a box they were told never to open. But one man went and opened it anyway. He unleashed all the evils of the world: envy... greed... pride... violence... control... All that was left in the box was a single ray of light: Hope.
Dialogue: Stay where you are! Perhaps you've heard this story? Once, when people were pure and innocent, there was a box they were told never to open. But one man went and opened it anyway. He unleashed all the evils of the world envy... greed... pride... violence... control... All that was left in the box was a single ray of light Hope.

Original: BANON:We now confront those evils... And you are that last ray of light, our only hope...
Dialogue: We now confront those evils... And you are that last ray of light, our only hope...

Original: BANON:I'm so tired... Let me rest a while.
Dialogue: I'm so tired... Let me rest a while.

Original: LOCKE:Someone important to me was jailed by the Empire. I've hated the Empire ever since... I joined the Returners when I realized the Empire was rotten to the core. I wanted to make a difference.
Dialogue: Someone important to me was jailed by the Empire. I've hated the Empire ever since... I joined the Returners when I realized the Empire was rotten to the core. I wanted to make a difference.

Original: TERRA:But...I have no significant "other" in my life...
Dialogue: But...I have no significant "other" in my life...

Original: LOCKE:That's not entirely true. Besides, I'm sure there are people who feel YOU'RE important to them! They are counting on you...
Dialogue: That's not entirely true. Besides, I'm sure there are people who feel YOU'RE important to them! They are counting on you...

Original: EDGAR:It's gonna be tough to talk you into helping us... If we push you too hard, we're no different than the Empire... So we want you to make up your own mind.
Dialogue: It's gonna be tough to talk you into helping us... If we push you too hard, we're no different than the Empire... So we want you to make up your own mind.

Original: SABIN:The only thing I can add is that you can trust my brother implicitly. He's always been fair with me. You can trust him, Terra... But don't you DARE tell him I said that!
Dialogue: The only thing I can add is that you can trust my brother implicitly. He's always been fair with me. You can trust him, Terra... But don't you DARE tell him I said that!

Original: BANON:What's going on? What happened?
Dialogue: What's going on? What happened?

Original: TERRA:He's badly wounded!
Dialogue: He's badly wounded!

Original: BANON:Someone did a number on him...
Dialogue: Someone did a number on him...

Original: BANON:They've found us... We haven't a moment to lose!
Dialogue: They've found us... We haven't a moment to lose!

Original: LOCKE:I know... "Someone" has to sneak into South Figaro and slow the Empire down, right?
Dialogue: I know... "Someone" has to sneak into South Figaro and slow the Empire down, right?

Original: EDGAR:This's right up your alley! Good luck!
Dialogue: This's right up your alley! Good luck!

Original: LOCKE:Terra... Please wait for me... And...please... ...don't let a lecherous young king, who shall remain nameless, near you!
Dialogue: Terra... Please wait for me... And...please... ...don't let a lecherous young king, who shall remain nameless, near you!

Original: SABIN:Big brother... Aren't you EVER going to grow up?
Dialogue: Big brother... Aren't you EVER going to grow up?

Original: BANON:What're we going to do?
Dialogue: What're we going to do?

Original: EDGAR:We'll escape down the Lete River, and make our way to Narshe. I want to see that Esper for myself...
Dialogue: We'll escape down the Lete River, and make our way to Narshe. I want to see that Esper for myself...

Original: BANON:Right. There's a raft by the back entrance. It's a gamble, but we're fresh out of options...
Dialogue: Right. There's a raft by the back entrance. It's a gamble, but we're fresh out of options...

Original: EDGAR:You're in danger here. Come with us to Narshe. You'll probably even gain some understanding of your own abilities...
Dialogue: You're in danger here. Come with us to Narshe. You'll probably even gain some understanding of your own abilities...

Original: BANON:We've no time to dilly-dally. Let's make for Narshe!
Dialogue: We've no time to dilly-dally. Let's make for Narshe!

Original: SABIN:I guess we thrashed it.
Dialogue: I guess we thrashed it.

Original: EDGAR:Don't bet on it...... It's probably just hiding from us......
Dialogue: Don't bet on it...... It's probably just hiding from us......

Original: TERRA:Ewww!! Something's stuck to my leg!
Dialogue: Ewww!! Something's stuck to my leg!

Original: EDGAR:Terra! Over here!
Dialogue: Terra! Over here!

Original: BANON:It's all right now.
Dialogue: It's all right now.

Original: SABIN:Watch out! I'm going to hit it with a Blitz!
Dialogue: Watch out! I'm going to hit it with a Blitz!

Original: EDGAR:No! Sabin!!
Dialogue: No! Sabin!!

Original: SABIN:Don't distract me, brother!!
Dialogue: Don't distract me, brother!!

Original: EDGAR:He's always been a tad zealous......
Dialogue: He's always been a tad zealous......

Original: BANON:Don't worry about him!
Dialogue: Don't worry about him!

Original: EDGAR:Are you sure he's okay, Banon?
Dialogue: Are you sure he's okay, Banon?

Original: BANON:You should know better than any of us! Any moment he'll flop right onto the raft!
Dialogue: You should know better than any of us! Any moment he'll flop right onto the raft!

Original: SABIN:What the...?
Dialogue: What the...?

Original: EDGAR:Seems a little too perky...... Ha...!
Dialogue: Seems a little too perky...... Ha...!

Original: EDGAR:Sabin!!!! Take care of yourself!
Dialogue: Sabin!!!! Take care of yourself!

Original: LOCKE:Nuts! Gotta get to Narshe on the fly...
Dialogue: Nuts! Gotta get to Narshe on the fly...

Original: MERCHANT:You're that thief, Locke, aren't you?
Dialogue: You're that thief, Locke, aren't you?

Original: LOCKE:Hey! Call me a treasure hunter, or I'll rip your lungs out!
Dialogue: Hey! Call me a treasure hunter, or I'll rip your lungs out!

Original: LOCKE:Here we go!
Dialogue: Here we go!

Original: LOCKE:These are a little tight, but the price was right.
Dialogue: These are a little tight, but the price was right.

Original: LOCKE:I've seen her before... Of course! She's one of the Empire's generals!
Dialogue: I've seen her before... Of course! She's one of the Empire's generals!

Original: GUARD:This's what happens to traitors!
Dialogue: This's what happens to traitors!

Original: GUARD:So, the mighty Celes has fallen!
Dialogue: So, the mighty Celes has fallen!

Original: CELES:How can you serve those cowards...
Dialogue: How can you serve those cowards...

Original: GUARD:Hold your tongue!
Dialogue: Hold your tongue!

Original: CELES:Isn't it true Kefka's going to poison the people of Doma, to the east?
Dialogue: Isn't it true Kefka's going to poison the people of Doma, to the east?

Original: GUARD:I'd hate to be in your shoes tomorrow!
Dialogue: I'd hate to be in your shoes tomorrow!

Original: LOCKE:I'm with the Returners. Name's Locke.
Dialogue: I'm with the Returners. Name's Locke.

Original: CELES:Returners!!! I used to be General Celes... Now I'm just a common traitor...
Dialogue: Returners!!! I used to be General Celes... Now I'm just a common traitor...

Original: LOCKE:Let's go!
Dialogue: Let's go!

Original: CELES:!? You'd take me along?
Dialogue: !? You'd take me along?

Original: CELES:Thanks, but no thanks. I can barely walk...
Dialogue: Thanks, but no thanks. I can barely walk...

Original: CELES:I'm grateful, but... Even if you got me out, you'd never be able to protect me. No, I think I'm better off here.
Dialogue: I'm grateful, but... Even if you got me out, you'd never be able to protect me. No, I think I'm better off here.

Original: LOCKE:I'll protect you!
Dialogue: I'll protect you!

Original: LOCKE:Trust me! You'll be fine!
Dialogue: Trust me! You'll be fine!

Original: LOCKE:Let's go!
Dialogue: Let's go!

Original: CELES:This soldier has something important on him...
Dialogue: This soldier has something important on him...

Original: SOLDIER:...'n some bread, too... Mumble Mumble...
Dialogue: ...'n some bread, too... Mumble Mumble...

Original: CELES:Why are you helping me?
Dialogue: Why are you helping me?

Original: LOCKE:You remind me of someone...
Dialogue: You remind me of someone...

Original: LOCKE:But what's it matter, anyway? I just want to, okay?!
Dialogue: But what's it matter, anyway? I just want to, okay?!

Original: LOCKE:What IS that noise?
Dialogue: What IS that noise?

Original: CELES:Something's coming outta the wall!!
Dialogue: Something's coming outta the wall!!

Original: CELES:TunnelArmr!! I'll draw its magic attack. It won't hurt us.
Dialogue: TunnelArmr!! I'll draw its magic attack. It won't hurt us.

Original: LOCKE:Come again?!
Dialogue: Come again?!

Original: CELES:I can simply absorb the attack with my Runic Blade.<
Dialogue: I can simply absorb the attack with my Runic Blade.<

Original: LOCKE:Are you sure you'll be okay?!
Dialogue: Are you sure you'll be okay?!

Original: CELES:Just you watch!!
Dialogue: Just you watch!!

Original: LOCKE:Whew!!! Looks like we're in the clear!
Dialogue: Whew!!! Looks like we're in the clear!

Original: TERRA:When Locke first helped me, he fiddled with something right around here.
Dialogue: When Locke first helped me, he fiddled with something right around here.

Original: EDGAR:Knowing him there's probably some secret switch in this rock wall...
Dialogue: Knowing him there's probably some secret switch in this rock wall...

Original: TERRA:What's that...?
Dialogue: What's that...?

Original: EDGAR:I think this's a security check point. If we follow the light exactly, we'll probably be okay. If we make a mistake, the light'll surround us. To proceed safely we must "tag" the glimmering light.
Dialogue: I think this's a security check point. If we follow the light exactly, we'll probably be okay. If we make a mistake, the light'll surround us. To proceed safely we must "tag" the glimmering light.

Original: ARVIS:Banon! King Edgar! ...and Terra!!!
Dialogue: Banon! King Edgar! ...and Terra!!!

Original: BANON:Arvis! What's happening here in Narshe?
Dialogue: Arvis! What's happening here in Narshe?

Original: ARVIS:The town's neutral. I've tried to get the people to side with the Returners, but... Anyway, why on earth have you come here?
Dialogue: The town's neutral. I've tried to get the people to side with the Returners, but... Anyway, why on earth have you come here?

Original: EDGAR:First, how are your people doing?
Dialogue: First, how are your people doing?

Original: ARVIS:They all went...slightly berserk when the Esper was discovered.
Dialogue: They all went...slightly berserk when the Esper was discovered.

Original: BANON:We believe this young woman is our only hope of reaching out to that Esper.
Dialogue: We believe this young woman is our only hope of reaching out to that Esper.

Original: ARVIS:My people are dying to know what the Esper looks like.
Dialogue: My people are dying to know what the Esper looks like.

Original: EDGAR:That Esper is either going to save us...or dig us an early grave...
Dialogue: That Esper is either going to save us...or dig us an early grave...

Original: SOLDIER A:Hey, have you heard?
Dialogue: Hey, have you heard?

Original: SOLDIER B:Oh, you mean...
Dialogue: Oh, you mean...

Original: SOLDIER A:Shhh! Quiet down. If Kefka catches us, we're toast.
Dialogue: Shhh! Quiet down. If Kefka catches us, we're toast.

Original: SOLDIER A:If he drives General Leo out of our battalion, he'll probably become the next general!
Dialogue: If he drives General Leo out of our battalion, he'll probably become the next general!

Original: SOLDIER B:Don't make me laugh! If someone like him becomes a general, I'll go home!
Dialogue: Don't make me laugh! If someone like him becomes a general, I'll go home!

Original: SOLDIER A:Shhhhh! What if he hears you? You'll be jailed!
Dialogue: Shhhhh! What if he hears you? You'll be jailed!

Original: SOLDIER B:Alright, alright!
Dialogue: Alright, alright!

Original: SOLDIER B:Uh, oh... Here he comes... Back to the waiting zone!
Dialogue: Uh, oh... Here he comes... Back to the waiting zone!

Original: KEFKA:Hey, you! You keeping a sharp lookout?
Dialogue: Hey, you! You keeping a sharp lookout?

Original: SOLDIER A:Yes, Sir. You're Kefka, correct? How are you, Sir?
Dialogue: Yes, Sir. You're Kefka, correct? How are you, Sir?

Original: KEFKA:Please! Save your petty small talk! Just do your job!
Dialogue: Please! Save your petty small talk! Just do your job!

Original: SOLDIER B:Phew...! Someone's gotta put that guy away! I'd like to tell him to his face he's no General Leo!
Dialogue: Phew...! Someone's gotta put that guy away! I'd like to tell him to his face he's no General Leo!

Original: SOLDIER A:Shhhh! Do I always have to tell you to keep it down?! You're hopeless...!
Dialogue: Shhhh! Do I always have to tell you to keep it down?! You're hopeless...!

Original: SOLDIER A:I hate that weirdo, Kefka. I don't even think he's human, not like General Leo...
Dialogue: I hate that weirdo, Kefka. I don't even think he's human, not like General Leo...

Original: COMMANDER:You two! We're about to storm Doma Castle...
Dialogue: You two! We're about to storm Doma Castle...

Original: DOMA SENTRY:It's hopeless. We can't keep them out.
Dialogue: It's hopeless. We can't keep them out.

Original: DOMA SENTRY:So, it's finally happening...
Dialogue: So, it's finally happening...

Original: CYAN:If we can fell their commander, they'll surely give up.
Dialogue: If we can fell their commander, they'll surely give up.

Original: CYAN:Let us give it a try.
Dialogue: Let us give it a try.

Original: CYAN:Thou musn't give up the fight!
Dialogue: Thou musn't give up the fight!

Original: DOMA SENTRY:Sir Cyan! Let their commander have it!
Dialogue: Sir Cyan! Let their commander have it!

Original: CYAN:I am Cyan, retainer to the King of Doma. I am your worst nightmare...
Dialogue: I am Cyan, retainer to the King of Doma. I am your worst nightmare...

Original: TROOPER:The general's been defeated! Run!!!
Dialogue: The general's been defeated! Run!!!

Original: CYAN:Walled up in there, we can wait out our enemy!
Dialogue: Walled up in there, we can wait out our enemy!

Original: SOLDIER:General Leo. The citizens of Doma seem to be playing a waiting game...
Dialogue: General Leo. The citizens of Doma seem to be playing a waiting game...

Original: LEO:So, that's their strategy.
Dialogue: So, that's their strategy.

Original: SOLDIER:General. We're ready to take the castle. Just give the order...
Dialogue: General. We're ready to take the castle. Just give the order...

Original: LEO:Patience! If we attack now, we'll have to sacrifice too many lives.
Dialogue: Patience! If we attack now, we'll have to sacrifice too many lives.

Original: SOLDIER:But, General! I'm ready to lay my life down at any time for the Empire!
Dialogue: But, General! I'm ready to lay my life down at any time for the Empire!

Original: LEO:You're from Maranda, right?
Dialogue: You're from Maranda, right?

Original: SOLDIER:Y...yes Sir. Why?
Dialogue: Y...yes Sir. Why?

Original: LEO:And your family lives there? Fall in battle, and I'll have to deliver the bad news... What shall I say to them? You have a life to go back to someday. Don't throw it all away for nothing. Emperor Gestahl wouldn't want that.
Dialogue: And your family lives there? Fall in battle, and I'll have to deliver the bad news... What shall I say to them? You have a life to go back to someday. Don't throw it all away for nothing. Emperor Gestahl wouldn't want that.

Original: SOLDIER:Yes, Sir!
Dialogue: Yes, Sir!

Original: SOLDIER:General Leo!
Dialogue: General Leo!

Original: SOLDIER:A carrier pigeon from Emperor Gestahl.
Dialogue: A carrier pigeon from Emperor Gestahl.

Original: LEO:The Emperor summons me. I must return immediately.
Dialogue: The Emperor summons me. I must return immediately.

Original: SOLDIER:I understand, Sir.
Dialogue: I understand, Sir.

Original: LEO:Right. I'll leave Doma in your hands.
Dialogue: Right. I'll leave Doma in your hands.

Original: SOLDIER:Yes, Sir.
Dialogue: Yes, Sir.

Original: LEO:Okay... Just don't jump the gun.Please...
Dialogue: Okay... Just don't jump the gun.Please...

Original: SOLDIER:Sir! Leave it to us, Sir!LEO:Right.
Dialogue: Sir! Leave it to us, Sir! LEO Right.

Original: KEFKA:Now that Leo's gone, I'll turn this water into a flowing river of poison!
Dialogue: Now that Leo's gone, I'll turn this water into a flowing river of poison!

Original: LEO:The Emperor has ordered me to return home. I don't want any trouble here!
Dialogue: The Emperor has ordered me to return home. I don't want any trouble here!

Original: KEFKA:You loser! I'll take care of this situation in no time!
Dialogue: You loser! I'll take care of this situation in no time!

Original: LEO:Don't be pompous! And DON'T forget that they are PEOPLE, just like you and me.
Dialogue: Don't be pompous! And DON'T forget that they are PEOPLE, just like you and me.

Original: KEFKA:We need not spare those lands that gave rise to the Returners!
Dialogue: We need not spare those lands that gave rise to the Returners!

Original: KEFKA:You just go and be a good little boy...!
Dialogue: You just go and be a good little boy...!

Original: KEFKA:Is the poison ready?
Dialogue: Is the poison ready?

Original: SOLDIER:But, General Leo said...
Dialogue: But, General Leo said...

Original: KEFKA:He's no longer here! I'm in charge now. Pour it!
Dialogue: He's no longer here! I'm in charge now. Pour it!

Original: SOLDIER:Some of our people are prisoners inside the castle! If we poison the river...
Dialogue: Some of our people are prisoners inside the castle! If we poison the river...

Original: KEFKA:Do it! Take 'em all out!
Dialogue: Do it! Take 'em all out!

Original: KEFKA:Unh? Silence! You're history, bub...
Dialogue: Unh? Silence! You're history, bub...

Original: SABIN:Kefka! Wait!!!
Dialogue: Kefka! Wait!!!

Original: KEFKA:"Wait," he says...... Do I look like a waiter?
Dialogue: "Wait," he says...... Do I look like a waiter?

Original: KEFKA:Ha, ha, ha! ...What a toad!
Dialogue: Ha, ha, ha! ...What a toad!

Original: KEFKA:Huh!? How long do you expect me to put up with you? Next time, you're a goner.
Dialogue: Huh!? How long do you expect me to put up with you? Next time, you're a goner.

Original: KEFKA:Oh, gripe! Hey! If you know what's good for you...
Dialogue: Oh, gripe! Hey! If you know what's good for you...

Original: KEFKA:Hee, hee! Nothing can beat the music of hundreds of voices screaming in unison! Uwa, ha, ha!
Dialogue: Hee, hee! Nothing can beat the music of hundreds of voices screaming in unison! Uwa, ha, ha!

Original: DOMA SENTRY:Sir Cyan! The Empire's base is bustling with activity. Something must be up!
Dialogue: Sir Cyan! The Empire's base is bustling with activity. Something must be up!

Original: CYAN:Huh? The water looks odd...
Dialogue: Huh? The water looks odd...

Original: DOMA SENTRY:Sir Cyan!
Dialogue: Sir Cyan!

Original: CYAN:This is... POISON!
Dialogue: This is... POISON!

Original: DOMA SENTRY:What lowdown, contemptible...!
Dialogue: What lowdown, contemptible...!

Original: CYAN:Guard our liege!
Dialogue: Guard our liege!

Original: DOMA SENTRY:To the King, on the double!
Dialogue: To the King, on the double!

Original: CYAN:Right! The King's room is near!
Dialogue: Right! The King's room is near!

Original: CYAN:Your Highness! Fear not!
Dialogue: Your Highness! Fear not!

Original: KING DOMA:Who's there?
Dialogue: Who's there?

Original: CYAN:Cyan, Excellency.
Dialogue: Cyan, Excellency.

Original: KING DOMA:Indeed! My sight is going fast... Can't see a thing...
Dialogue: Indeed! My sight is going fast... Can't see a thing...

Original: CYAN:Excellency! Hang on!
Dialogue: Excellency! Hang on!

Original: KING DOMA:Cyan... You have defended the realm since my father's days...hack, cough... Thank you... It's over... Our kingdom is through.
Dialogue: Cyan... You have defended the realm since my father's days...hack, cough... Thank you... It's over... Our kingdom is through.

Original: CYAN:Not yet, Highness!
Dialogue: Not yet, Highness!

Original: KING DOMA:I fear for your family. Uhh...chest is on f...fire...
Dialogue: I fear for your family. Uhh...chest is on f...fire...

Original: CYAN:Save your strength! Don't talk!
Dialogue: Save your strength! Don't talk!

Original: KING DOMA:Go...run to your family...hack... gasp... ......
Dialogue: Go...run to your family...hack... gasp... ......

Original: DOMA SENTRY:Sir Cyan!
Dialogue: Sir Cyan!

Original: CYAN:There have to be some survivors in the castle!
Dialogue: There have to be some survivors in the castle!

Original: DOMA SENTRY:Let's split up...
Dialogue: Let's split up...

Original: CYAN:Elayne! Elayne! Wake up!
Dialogue: Elayne! Elayne! Wake up!

Original: CYAN:This... This...can't be happening!
Dialogue: This... This...can't be happening!

Original: CYAN:! Owain... NOT YOU TOO! Son...you can't BOTH leave me!
Dialogue: ! Owain... NOT YOU TOO! Son...you can't BOTH leave me!

Original: CYAN:D... Dear me...
Dialogue: D... Dear me...

Original: CYAN:I...impossible! Idiotic!!!
Dialogue: I...impossible! Idiotic!!!

Original: CYAN:We can't forgive this! The Empire must pay!
Dialogue: We can't forgive this! The Empire must pay!

Original: WARRIOR:I am Cyan, retainer to King Doma!
Dialogue: I am Cyan, retainer to King Doma!

Original: SOLDIER:The enemy! Get ready, everyone!
Dialogue: The enemy! Get ready, everyone!

Original: SABIN:May I give you a hand?!
Dialogue: May I give you a hand?!

Original: CYAN:Thank you... whomever you are.
Dialogue: Thank you... whomever you are.

Original: CYAN:Ohhh! This is too much!
Dialogue: Ohhh! This is too much!

Original: SABIN:Let me have at it!
Dialogue: Let me have at it!

Original: CYAN:What a mess!! Be careful, Sir!!
Dialogue: What a mess!! Be careful, Sir!!

Original: CYAN:Urgh!!! Who released this poison?
Dialogue: Urgh!!! Who released this poison?

Original: CYAN:The thought had occurred to me as well!
Dialogue: The thought had occurred to me as well!

Original: CYAN:Thank you, kind sir!
Dialogue: Thank you, kind sir!

Original: SABIN:Allow me to thank you! I am Sabin, from Figaro. Now, let's scram!
Dialogue: Allow me to thank you! I am Sabin, from Figaro. Now, let's scram!

Original: CYAN:But what of my home, my family...my friends?
Dialogue: But what of my home, my family...my friends?

Original: SABIN:Look... If we stick around any longer we'll have a regiment of troops down our throats.
Dialogue: Look... If we stick around any longer we'll have a regiment of troops down our throats.

Original: SOLDIER:Got 'em! Over here!
Dialogue: Got 'em! Over here!

Original: SABIN:Hoo, boy... I have a great idea... Come over here.
Dialogue: Hoo, boy... I have a great idea... Come over here.

Original: CYAN:Sir Sabin! What on earth are these?
Dialogue: Sir Sabin! What on earth are these?

Original: SABIN:I'll explain later! Relax. Just climb in!
Dialogue: I'll explain later! Relax. Just climb in!

Original: CYAN:Sir Sabin! How might these abominations be manipulated?
Dialogue: Sir Sabin! How might these abominations be manipulated?

Original: SABIN:I'm getting sick of this! Thou art such a pain in the...! Confound it all! I'm starting to talk like you! Now listen! Just use those levers located by your hands.
Dialogue: I'm getting sick of this! Thou art such a pain in the...! Confound it all! I'm starting to talk like you! Now listen! Just use those levers located by your hands.

Original: CYAN:Sir Sabin!! It is I who is in your debt!
Dialogue: Sir Sabin!! It is I who is in your debt!

Original: SABIN:Forget it. Now, come on!
Dialogue: Forget it. Now, come on!

Original: SOLDIER:Hey! What are you doing?
Dialogue: Hey! What are you doing?

Original: CYAN:Aaahhh! We can't stop now!
Dialogue: Aaahhh! We can't stop now!

Original: SABIN:Then let's just bust through!
Dialogue: Then let's just bust through!

Original: SABIN:Can't believe we've made it this far... Say, how do we get to Narshe from here?
Dialogue: Can't believe we've made it this far... Say, how do we get to Narshe from here?

Original: CYAN:Narshe, eh? Only one route, through the forest to the south.
Dialogue: Narshe, eh? Only one route, through the forest to the south.

Original: SABIN:All right! It's decided. Let's get going!
Dialogue: All right! It's decided. Let's get going!

Original: CYAN:A train's there!? But I thought Doma's railway had been destroyed...?
Dialogue: A train's there!? But I thought Doma's railway had been destroyed...?

Original: SABIN:May be survivors inside. Let's take a look.
Dialogue: May be survivors inside. Let's take a look.

Original: SABIN:Hey! We can get in right here!
Dialogue: Hey! We can get in right here!

Original: CYAN:Sir Sabin!
Dialogue: Sir Sabin!

Original: SABIN:We can't just wander around out here! We have to go on board!
Dialogue: We can't just wander around out here! We have to go on board!

Original: CYAN:Sir Sabin!
Dialogue: Sir Sabin!

Original: SABIN:Don't worry!
Dialogue: Don't worry!

Original: CYAN:Sir Sabin!
Dialogue: Sir Sabin!

Original: SABIN:What on earth...?
Dialogue: What on earth...?

Original: CYAN:Let me off! This train's haunted!
Dialogue: Let me off! This train's haunted!

Original: SABIN:I...it's moving!
Dialogue: I...it's moving!

Original: CYAN:If we don't get off now...
Dialogue: If we don't get off now...

Original: SABIN:Won't open!
Dialogue: Won't open!

Original: CYAN:We're too late.
Dialogue: We're too late.

Original: SABIN:What's with this train?
Dialogue: What's with this train?

Original: CYAN:This is the Phantom Train... It carries the departed to...the other side.
Dialogue: This is the Phantom Train... It carries the departed to...the other side.

Original: SABIN:Wait a sec... I don't want to go THERE!
Dialogue: Wait a sec... I don't want to go THERE!

Original: CYAN:We all have to go sometime...
Dialogue: We all have to go sometime...

Original: SABIN:I have things to do HERE. We have to stop this thing. Let's make for the engine.
Dialogue: I have things to do HERE. We have to stop this thing. Let's make for the engine.

Original: CYAN:I believe we're stuck!
Dialogue: I believe we're stuck!

Original: SABIN:I know!CYAN:You have an idea?
Dialogue: I know! CYAN You have an idea?

Original: SABIN:Okay... The time has come to see if all my training has paid off. Come, Cyan!
Dialogue: Okay... The time has come to see if all my training has paid off. Come, Cyan!

Original: PHANTOM TRAIN:So! You've been slowing my progress!
Dialogue: So! You've been slowing my progress!

Original: PHANTOM TRAIN:I will let you go... <D>...but first there is something I must do...
Dialogue: I will let you go... <D>...but first there is something I must do...

Original: CYAN:Gulp...where are we?
Dialogue: Gulp...where are we?

Original: SABIN:Hoo, boy! Finally got off...
Dialogue: Hoo, boy! Finally got off...

Original: SABIN:We shouldn't be here. Let's go NOW!
Dialogue: We shouldn't be here. Let's go NOW!

Original: CYAN:No!!! Elayne! Owain!!
Dialogue: No!!! Elayne! Owain!!

Original: SABIN:Cyan! Is that your wife and child?
Dialogue: Cyan! Is that your wife and child?

Original: CYAN:Please, wait!
Dialogue: Please, wait!

Original: SABIN:This must be Baren Falls.
Dialogue: This must be Baren Falls.

Original: CYAN:To the south is the Veldt. Dangerous creatures there.
Dialogue: To the south is the Veldt. Dangerous creatures there.

Original: SABIN:And the Empire's right on our tails.
Dialogue: And the Empire's right on our tails.

Original: CYAN:If we can slip through the Veldt, we can reach the town of Mobliz, to the east...
Dialogue: If we can slip through the Veldt, we can reach the town of Mobliz, to the east...

Original: SABIN:What the......
Dialogue: What the......

Original: CYAN:Thou art so......odd.
Dialogue: Thou art so......odd.

Original: CYAN:I'm Cyan and he's Sabin.
Dialogue: I'm Cyan and he's Sabin.

Original: GAU:You Sabin...... you Cyan, me want more food!!
Dialogue: You Sabin...... you Cyan, me want more food!!

Original: SABIN:No more for you.
Dialogue: No more for you.

Original: GAU:You go......get more for me.
Dialogue: You go......get more for me.

Original: SABIN:You're a regular munchkin!
Dialogue: You're a regular munchkin!

Original: GAU:And you......afraid of me!
Dialogue: And you......afraid of me!

Original: SABIN:You wanna fight?
Dialogue: You wanna fight?

Dialogue: Me not wanna hurt you......

Dialogue: Stop looking at me like that!

Dialogue: Wheeze......puff......! You're pretty tough!

Original: GAU:Wah, ha! That fun! You strong!
Dialogue: Wah, ha! That fun! You strong!

Original: GAU:Me like dancing! You good leader!
Dialogue: Me like dancing! You good leader!

Original: SABIN:Shut up!!
Dialogue: Shut up!!

Original: CYAN:Simmer down, sirs! And thou, o wild one...... who might thou be?
Dialogue: Simmer down, sirs! And thou, o wild one...... who might thou be?

Original: GAU:Thou! Thou!
Dialogue: Thou! Thou!

Original: GAU:Thou! Thou!
Dialogue: Thou! Thou!

Original: GAU:Thou! Thou!
Dialogue: Thou! Thou!

Original: GAU:Thou! Thou!
Dialogue: Thou! Thou!

Original: GAU:You angry?
Dialogue: You angry?

Original: GAU:Cyan! You angry......me?
Dialogue: Cyan! You angry......me?

Original: GAU:Cyan! You angry......me?
Dialogue: Cyan! You angry......me?

Original: GAU:Cyan! You angry......me?
Dialogue: Cyan! You angry......me?

Original: SABIN:Listen, his family was just......
Dialogue: Listen, his family was just......

Original: GAU:Me understand......me sorry. Me not mean person......
Dialogue: Me understand......me sorry. Me not mean person......

Original: CYAN:Look! We can't have ye two prancing 'round all day! Gau, I think we're going to get on well together. Why don't you join us?
Dialogue: Look! We can't have ye two prancing 'round all day! Gau, I think we're going to get on well together. Why don't you join us?

Original: GAU:Ah! I give you present! Gau give Cyan and Sabin nice gift in thanks for food!
Dialogue: Ah! I give you present! Gau give Cyan and Sabin nice gift in thanks for food!

Original: SABIN:What manner of rubbish do you suppose he's gonna...?
Dialogue: What manner of rubbish do you suppose he's gonna...?

Original: GAU:Gau's treasure...... shiny, shiny!! Shiny, shiny, shiny!!!
Dialogue: Gau's treasure...... shiny, shiny!! Shiny, shiny, shiny!!!

Original: SABIN:Can anything be THAT shiny?
Dialogue: Can anything be THAT shiny?

Original: GAU:Does Mr. Thou like shiny thing?
Dialogue: Does Mr. Thou like shiny thing?

Original: SABIN:Mr. Thou's that one, over THERE!! A shiny thing, eh...? Think how jealous Locke's gonna be when he hears about this!
Dialogue: Mr. Thou's that one, over THERE!! A shiny thing, eh...? Think how jealous Locke's gonna be when he hears about this!

Original: GAU:Who be Locke? He bad man? Maybe he try steal my treasure!
Dialogue: Who be Locke? He bad man? Maybe he try steal my treasure!

Original: SABIN:? Well, he's...... Listen when someone's talking to you!
Dialogue: ? Well, he's...... Listen when someone's talking to you!

Original: CYAN:I think he's trying to tell us something!
Dialogue: I think he's trying to tell us something!

Original: SABIN:Urgh......all right......carry on......
Dialogue: Urgh......all right......carry on......

Original: GAU:Here! Here! Shiny thing here!! Sabin, place where you buy food... it called Mobliz! Cyan, place where you stand...... river brought you there...... Now, we go Crescent Mountain! Shiny thing, there!
Dialogue: Here! Here! Shiny thing here!! Sabin, place where you buy food... it called Mobliz! Cyan, place where you stand...... river brought you there...... Now, we go Crescent Mountain! Shiny thing, there!

Original: CYAN:Look, let's just go along with him to this Crescent Mountain.
Dialogue: Look, let's just go along with him to this Crescent Mountain.

Original: SABIN:Phew......why'd we invite him along, anyway...?
Dialogue: Phew......why'd we invite him along, anyway...?

Original: GAU:Mr. Thou! Hurry up! We're leaving!!
Dialogue: Mr. Thou! Hurry up! We're leaving!!

Original: SABIN:Hey! I told you once, I'm not Mr. Thou!!!
Dialogue: Hey! I told you once, I'm not Mr. Thou!!!

Original: KAPPA:Here's how to build up Gau's skills.
Dialogue: Here's how to build up Gau's skills.

Original: SABIN:Cyan! The shiny thing Gau spoke of is in here.
Dialogue: Cyan! The shiny thing Gau spoke of is in here.

Original: CYAN:Uh, Sir Gau, where exactly is it?
Dialogue: Uh, Sir Gau, where exactly is it?

Original: SABIN:Shall we look around?CYAN:Indeed!
Dialogue: Shall we look around? CYAN Indeed!

Original: CYAN:Is this it? Gau's "treasure"?
Dialogue: Is this it? Gau's "treasure"?

Original: CYAN:Looks like glass...
Dialogue: Looks like glass...

Original: SABIN:Looks like it just might fit...
Dialogue: Looks like it just might fit...

Original: SABIN:Hummm... Is this of any use?
Dialogue: Hummm... Is this of any use?

Original: SABIN:Will this really let us breathe underwater?
Dialogue: Will this really let us breathe underwater?

Original: SABIN:Let's go!
Dialogue: Let's go!

Original: SABIN:No kidding.
Dialogue: No kidding.

Original: SABIN:But unless we hop in, we won't see our friends again...
Dialogue: But unless we hop in, we won't see our friends again...

Original: SABIN:Let's go!
Dialogue: Let's go!

Original: CYAN:Narshe is just a stone's throw away!
Dialogue: Narshe is just a stone's throw away!

Original: SABIN:I hope the others arrived safely!
Dialogue: I hope the others arrived safely!

Original: CYAN:I'm sure they did.
Dialogue: I'm sure they did.

Original: GAU:Me hope so, too...
Dialogue: Me hope so, too...

Original: ELDER:I understand all of it... Except... How can WE be encouraging bloodshed?
Dialogue: I understand all of it... Except... How can WE be encouraging bloodshed?

Original: ARVIS:I never said...that!
Dialogue: I never said...that!

Original: ELDER:Something like it.
Dialogue: Something like it.

Original: BANON:Ha! He's right you know!
Dialogue: Ha! He's right you know!

Original: BANON:Our blood will spill because of you.
Dialogue: Our blood will spill because of you.

Original: BANON:Emperor Gestahl's racing to acquire Magitek power. He's set his sights on the Esper that was found here! The increased use of magitek power'll surely lead to global destruction...
Dialogue: Emperor Gestahl's racing to acquire Magitek power. He's set his sights on the Esper that was found here! The increased use of magitek power'll surely lead to global destruction...

Original: ELDER:The War of the Magi...
Dialogue: The War of the Magi...

Original: ELDER:People will never learn...
Dialogue: People will never learn...

Original: EDGAR:Sabin! You're all right!
Dialogue: Sabin! You're all right!

Original: EDGAR:Who's with you?
Dialogue: Who's with you?

Original: SABIN:Oh, this is...
Dialogue: Oh, this is...

Original: CYAN:I'm Cyan, retainer to the lord of Doma!
Dialogue: I'm Cyan, retainer to the lord of Doma!

Original: SABIN:The people of Doma were wiped out by the Empire...
Dialogue: The people of Doma were wiped out by the Empire...

Original: CYAN:Kefka poisoned...everyone...
Dialogue: Kefka poisoned...everyone...

Original: ELDER:But...that was only because Doma was collaborating with the Returners! If we make that mistake...
Dialogue: But...that was only because Doma was collaborating with the Returners! If we make that mistake...

Original: LOCKE:That's nonsense!!
Dialogue: That's nonsense!!

Original: LOCKE:The Empire's poised to attack Narshe right now!
Dialogue: The Empire's poised to attack Narshe right now!

Original: BANON:Locke. Where'd you hear that?
Dialogue: Locke. Where'd you hear that?

Original: LOCKE:Celes, here, was one of the Empire's generals...
Dialogue: Celes, here, was one of the Empire's generals...

Original: CYAN:Grrr! I knew she seemed familiar. Sir Gau, out of my way!
Dialogue: Grrr! I knew she seemed familiar. Sir Gau, out of my way!

Original: CYAN:This's General Celes! She torched Maranda! She's an Imperial spy! Now, stand aside!
Dialogue: This's General Celes! She torched Maranda! She's an Imperial spy! Now, stand aside!

Original: LOCKE:WAIT! Celes has joined the Returners! She's fighting with us, now!
Dialogue: WAIT! Celes has joined the Returners! She's fighting with us, now!

Original: LOCKE:I promised I'd protect her. I WILL NOT back out on my word.
Dialogue: I promised I'd protect her. I WILL NOT back out on my word.

Original: EDGAR:Locke... Are you still thinking about... that?
Dialogue: Locke... Are you still thinking about... that?

Original: TERRA:I was also an Imperial soldier.
Dialogue: I was also an Imperial soldier.

Original: EDGAR:The Empire's evil. But not ALL of its citizens are!
Dialogue: The Empire's evil. But not ALL of its citizens are!

Original: KEFKA:I don't care what you do here, JUST GET ME THAT ESPER!!
Dialogue: I don't care what you do here, JUST GET ME THAT ESPER!!

Original: SOLDIER:Lord Kefka! There're civilians here...!
Dialogue: Lord Kefka! There're civilians here...!

Original: KEFKA:Exterminate everyone!
Dialogue: Exterminate everyone!

Original: SOLDIER:But Narshe is neutral...
Dialogue: But Narshe is neutral...

Original: KEFKA:Read my lips!! Dispose of any who oppose us! March!
Dialogue: Read my lips!! Dispose of any who oppose us! March!

Original: ELDER:We really have no choice. Let's make ready for war!
Dialogue: We really have no choice. Let's make ready for war!

Original: BANON:They're after the Esper.
Dialogue: They're after the Esper.

Original: ELDER:We moved it into the hills.
Dialogue: We moved it into the hills.

Original: EDGAR:Then we're going up after it!
Dialogue: Then we're going up after it!

Original: EDGAR:Locke has a complicated past. I wouldn't go thinking he's fallen for you or something!
Dialogue: Locke has a complicated past. I wouldn't go thinking he's fallen for you or something!

Original: CELES:I'm a soldier, not some love-starved twit!
Dialogue: I'm a soldier, not some love-starved twit!

Original: EDGAR:Cold as ice......
Dialogue: Cold as ice......

Original: CELES:So, you were born with the power of magic!? Isn't it a lovely gift...
Dialogue: So, you were born with the power of magic!? Isn't it a lovely gift...

Original: TERRA:You...can use magic, too?
Dialogue: You...can use magic, too?

Original: CELES:When I was a baby I was artificially infused with magic, and raised as a Magitek Knight.
Dialogue: When I was a baby I was artificially infused with magic, and raised as a Magitek Knight.

Original: TERRA:Have you...loved anyone?
Dialogue: Have you...loved anyone?

Original: CELES:??? What's that supposed to mean?!
Dialogue: ??? What's that supposed to mean?!

Original: CYAN:Don't think for a moment I trust you!
Dialogue: Don't think for a moment I trust you!

Original: CELES:Fine. Use your own eyes, then decide.
Dialogue: Fine. Use your own eyes, then decide.

Original: BANON:They're coming!
Dialogue: They're coming!

Original: KEFKA:Oho!! It's General Celes, the traitor! How delightful! This'll be fun!
Dialogue: Oho!! It's General Celes, the traitor! How delightful! This'll be fun!

Original: KEFKA:Go!! Get those vile insects!
Dialogue: Go!! Get those vile insects!

Original: KEFKA:Don't think you won! I'll be back!
Dialogue: Don't think you won! I'll be back!

Original: KEFKA:Aack!! I won't forget this!
Dialogue: Aack!! I won't forget this!

Original: EDGAR:Where's the Esper?
Dialogue: Where's the Esper?

Original: LOCKE:Is it okay?
Dialogue: Is it okay?

Original: EDGAR:That was a close call!
Dialogue: That was a close call!

Original: CYAN:Can it still be alive?
Dialogue: Can it still be alive?

Original: LOCKE:Terra!! What is it!?
Dialogue: Terra!! What is it!?

Original: SABIN:Terra 'n the Esper...
Dialogue: Terra 'n the Esper...

Original: EDGAR:There's...some kinda reaction!
Dialogue: There's...some kinda reaction!

Original: TERRA:Huh? W......what's going on......? What!? What am I feeling?! Please......tell me! Who am I? WHO?!
Dialogue: Huh? W......what's going on......? What!? What am I feeling?! Please......tell me! Who am I? WHO?!

Original: CELES:An Esper......I can actually feel its mind......
Dialogue: An Esper......I can actually feel its mind......

Original: EDGAR:Terra......Step away from the Esper......
Dialogue: Terra......Step away from the Esper......

Original: CELES:You're awake?
Dialogue: You're awake?

Original: LOCKE:... Where's Terra?!
Dialogue: ... Where's Terra?!

Original: CELES:She changed into a...something, and...took off. She looked like...
Dialogue: She changed into a...something, and...took off. She looked like...

Original: CELES:She looked like... an Esper...
Dialogue: She looked like... an Esper...

Original: EDGAR:Locke! You okay?
Dialogue: Locke! You okay?

Original: EDGAR:Something happened to Terra... There seems to be some connection between Espers and her... Anyway, we need to find her. Witnesses saw her screaming across the sky to the west.
Dialogue: Something happened to Terra... There seems to be some connection between Espers and her... Anyway, we need to find her. Witnesses saw her screaming across the sky to the west.

Original: LOCKE:Let's go! I promised her I'd...
Dialogue: Let's go! I promised her I'd...

Original: EDGAR:Think, people! The Empire still wants that Esper.
Dialogue: Think, people! The Empire still wants that Esper.

Original: SABIN:Banon needs our help, too...
Dialogue: Banon needs our help, too...

Original: CYAN:A former Imperial soldier... But we've no choice. We must help her!
Dialogue: A former Imperial soldier... But we've no choice. We must help her!

Original: EDGAR:Let's split up. Those who aren't searching for Terra will stay and guard Narshe. Figaro Castle can shuttle us to the western province. Then we'll make for Kohlingen or Jidoor.
Dialogue: Let's split up. Those who aren't searching for Terra will stay and guard Narshe. Figaro Castle can shuttle us to the western province. Then we'll make for Kohlingen or Jidoor.

Original: RAMUH:She's scared, you know.
Dialogue: She's scared, you know.

Original: RAMUH:This girl is your friend?
Dialogue: This girl is your friend?

Original: RAMUH:You call her Terra... ...Terra?? How odd...
Dialogue: You call her Terra... ...Terra?? How odd...

Original: RAMUH:She is undamaged. But I fear she can't understand you. As for me, I am Ramuh. The Esper, Ramuh.
Dialogue: She is undamaged. But I fear she can't understand you. As for me, I am Ramuh. The Esper, Ramuh.

Original: RAMUH:That doesn't mean we don't live here, too. Espers take a variety of forms. Sometimes we live here, taking the shape of humans. You have nothing to fear from us.
Dialogue: That doesn't mean we don't live here, too. Espers take a variety of forms. Sometimes we live here, taking the shape of humans. You have nothing to fear from us.

Original: RAMUH:Humans and Espers can't survive together.
Dialogue: Humans and Espers can't survive together.

Original: RAMUH:No, that was no fairy tale. That was true. We started out as friends. Then along came the War of the Magi...
Dialogue: No, that was no fairy tale. That was true. We started out as friends. Then along came the War of the Magi...

Original: RAMUH:It took place...long ago. Espers fought humans who were infused with magical power extracted from Espers... Fearing our magical powers would once again become a target, we fashioned a new realm, and moved there.
Dialogue: It took place...long ago. Espers fought humans who were infused with magical power extracted from Espers... Fearing our magical powers would once again become a target, we fashioned a new realm, and moved there.

Original: RAMUH:Even as we speak, many of my kind are trapped in the Empire's Magitek Research Facility, being... ...drained of their powers... I fled here to avoid a similar fate.
Dialogue: Even as we speak, many of my kind are trapped in the Empire's Magitek Research Facility, being... ...drained of their powers... I fled here to avoid a similar fate.

Original: RAMUH:That's right, relax.
Dialogue: That's right, relax.

Original: RAMUH:I sensed that Terra was in trouble. My magic...summoned her here.
Dialogue: I sensed that Terra was in trouble. My magic...summoned her here.

Original: RAMUH:No, she's actually quite different.
Dialogue: No, she's actually quite different.

Original: RAMUH:Her very existence strikes fear into her own heart.
Dialogue: Her very existence strikes fear into her own heart.

Original: RAMUH:When she accepts this aspect of herself, I think she'll be all right.
Dialogue: When she accepts this aspect of herself, I think she'll be all right.

Original: RAMUH:Then free those of my kind imprisoned in Gestahl's Magitek Research Facility. One of them can surely help her.
Dialogue: Then free those of my kind imprisoned in Gestahl's Magitek Research Facility. One of them can surely help her.

Original: RAMUH:Like a coward, I escaped leaving the others there. It'll be the end of them...
Dialogue: Like a coward, I escaped leaving the others there. It'll be the end of them...

Original: RAMUH:Gestahl's methods are incorrect. You can't drain a live Esper of all its power. It is only when we are reduced to Magicite that our abilities can be transferred in total...
Dialogue: Gestahl's methods are incorrect. You can't drain a live Esper of all its power. It is only when we are reduced to Magicite that our abilities can be transferred in total...

Original: RAMUH:When we transform into Magicite, our power can be relocated.
Dialogue: When we transform into Magicite, our power can be relocated.

Original: RAMUH:That's what's left of us when we...pass away.
Dialogue: That's what's left of us when we...pass away.

Original: RAMUH:These are my comrades who fell while escaping the Empire. And I will give you my power, as well...
Dialogue: These are my comrades who fell while escaping the Empire. And I will give you my power, as well...

Original: EDGAR:Let's talk on the way!
Dialogue: Let's talk on the way!

Original: EDGAR:The Empire's trying to drain magic from Espers...
Dialogue: The Empire's trying to drain magic from Espers...

Original: SABIN:This can't be true... Celes...?
Dialogue: This can't be true... Celes...?

Original: CELES:I don't remember because I was asleep when they...augmented me. But I've heard rumors to that effect.
Dialogue: I don't remember because I was asleep when they...augmented me. But I've heard rumors to that effect.

Original: CYAN:Then we're going in...
Dialogue: Then we're going in...

Original: EDGAR:We'd best split into 2 groups. We still need to beef up our defenses in Narshe.
Dialogue: We'd best split into 2 groups. We still need to beef up our defenses in Narshe.

Original: CELES:I'll go to the Empire. I know it well...
Dialogue: I'll go to the Empire. I know it well...

Original: SABIN:But alone...?
Dialogue: But alone...?

Original: LOCKE:Don't worry, I'll go with her.
Dialogue: Don't worry, I'll go with her.

Original: CYAN:You need a hand?
Dialogue: You need a hand?

Original: LOCKE:Please wait for us in Narshe. We'll find our way back safely.
Dialogue: Please wait for us in Narshe. We'll find our way back safely.

Original: CELES:So...how we gonna get there? The Empire's on the continent to the south. No boats go there...
Dialogue: So...how we gonna get there? The Empire's on the continent to the south. No boats go there...

Original: LOCKE:The people of Jidoor, a town to the south, can probably help us.
Dialogue: The people of Jidoor, a town to the south, can probably help us.

Original: CELES:Why are you coming with me?
Dialogue: Why are you coming with me?

Original: LOCKE:Well... There're bound to be treasures there. And besides, I've always wanted an inside look at the Empire!
Dialogue: Well... There're bound to be treasures there. And besides, I've always wanted an inside look at the Empire!

Original: CELES:Are you talking to me?
Dialogue: Are you talking to me?

Original: IMPRESARIO:Sorry...my mistake. Wow, you could pass for Maria in a heartbeat! Hoo boy, now I really am in trouble...
Dialogue: Sorry...my mistake. Wow, you could pass for Maria in a heartbeat! Hoo boy, now I really am in trouble...

Original: MASTER:He's the director of the operas here. Everyone just calls him [Impresario.] He's been in a tizzy ever since that letter arrived.
Dialogue: He's the director of the operas here. Everyone just calls him [Impresario.] He's been in a tizzy ever since that letter arrived.

Original: LOCKE:Who's this "Wandering..."? what's-his-name?
Dialogue: Who's this "Wandering..."? what's-his-name?

Original: MASTER:You born on a farm, son?
Dialogue: You born on a farm, son?

Original: CELES:If we could get that airship, we'd make the Empire in no time.
Dialogue: If we could get that airship, we'd make the Empire in no time.

Original: LOCKE:Let's set up a meeting...with Setzer...
Dialogue: Let's set up a meeting...with Setzer...

Original: IMPRESARIO:Ah! You again!
Dialogue: Ah! You again!

Original: LOCKE:I read that letter. Setzer's coming to steal her...
Dialogue: I read that letter. Setzer's coming to steal her...

Original: IMPRESARIO:He'll probably appear right at the climax of Scene 1. He loves an entrance...
Dialogue: He'll probably appear right at the climax of Scene 1. He loves an entrance...

Original: LOCKE:Right! If we could only grab him then...!
Dialogue: Right! If we could only grab him then...!

Original: IMPRESARIO:Dear me, NO! You'll ruin the performance! I'll lose my job!
Dialogue: Dear me, NO! You'll ruin the performance! I'll lose my job!

Original: CELES:Then you're history!
Dialogue: Then you're history!

Original: IMPRESARIO:This is simply horrid! I want the performance to be a success! But I don't want Maria to be abducted...!
Dialogue: This is simply horrid! I want the performance to be a success! But I don't want Maria to be abducted...!

Original: LOCKE:We'll let him grab her...
Dialogue: We'll let him grab her...

Original: LOCKE:We'll use Celes as a decoy. After she's abducted, I'll follow 'em right to his airship!
Dialogue: We'll use Celes as a decoy. After she's abducted, I'll follow 'em right to his airship!

Original: IMPRESARIO:Are you mad?!! If something should happen to Maria...
Dialogue: Are you mad?!! If something should happen to Maria...

Original: LOCKE:That's why the decoy! We'll hide Maria somewhere safe!
Dialogue: That's why the decoy! We'll hide Maria somewhere safe!

Original: IMPRESARIO:Come again?
Dialogue: Come again?

Original: LOCKE:You said SHE looks like Maria, right?
Dialogue: You said SHE looks like Maria, right?

Original: CELES:Now just a minute...
Dialogue: Now just a minute...

Original: LOCKE:Celes will be our Maria! She'll lead us to the airship!
Dialogue: Celes will be our Maria! She'll lead us to the airship!

Original: CELES:W...wait! I'm a GENERAL, not some opera floozy!
Dialogue: W...wait! I'm a GENERAL, not some opera floozy!

Original: LOCKE:Not bad, Celes!
Dialogue: Not bad, Celes!

Original: ULTROS:Mwa, ha, ha! I'll pretend to be Setzer and foil their little plan!
Dialogue: Mwa, ha, ha! I'll pretend to be Setzer and foil their little plan!

Original: LOCKE:Let's get ready! Celes, it's show time!
Dialogue: Let's get ready! Celes, it's show time!

Original: ULTROS:D'haaaaa! Come on! Read it...!
Dialogue: D'haaaaa! Come on! Read it...!

Original: LOCKE:Aye yai yai! Izzat...you!?
Dialogue: Aye yai yai! Izzat...you!?

Original: CELES:Locke. Why did you help me escape back there?
Dialogue: Locke. Why did you help me escape back there?

Original: LOCKE:I...once abandoned someone when she needed me...
Dialogue: I...once abandoned someone when she needed me...

Original: CELES:Somewhere inside you were saving...her, weren't you...?
Dialogue: Somewhere inside you were saving...her, weren't you...?

Original: LOCKE:That ribbon suits you.
Dialogue: That ribbon suits you.

Original: CELES:On with the show! This is a big scene in which Maria senses that something's happened to Draco!
Dialogue: On with the show! This is a big scene in which Maria senses that something's happened to Draco!

Original: LOCKE:You'd better check the score one last time.
Dialogue: You'd better check the score one last time.

Original: DRACO:Come, Maria! Follow my lead...
Dialogue: Come, Maria! Follow my lead...

Original: DRACO:Ha, ha, ha...
Dialogue: Ha, ha, ha...

Original: CHANCELLOR:Prince Ralse is looking for a dance partner. Leave the past behind! Our kingdom is adopting the spirit of the East...!
Dialogue: Prince Ralse is looking for a dance partner. Leave the past behind! Our kingdom is adopting the spirit of the East...!

Original: LOCKE:Well done, Celes.
Dialogue: Well done, Celes.

Original: LOCKE:Uh oh...Better tell the Impresario!
Dialogue: Uh oh...Better tell the Impresario!

Original: IMPRESARIO:But how might he disrupt the opera? ...With that?!
Dialogue: But how might he disrupt the opera? ...With that?!

Original: ULTROS:Mwa ha ha! Let's see if Maria can shrug THIS off!
Dialogue: Mwa ha ha! Let's see if Maria can shrug THIS off!

Original: ULTROS:N'ghaaa! This is heavier than I thought! It'll take me 5 minutes to drop it!
Dialogue: N'ghaaa! This is heavier than I thought! It'll take me 5 minutes to drop it!

Original: LOCKE:We haven't a second to lose!
Dialogue: We haven't a second to lose!

Original: IMPRESARIO:Talk to the man in the room to the far right! He'll help you get up there!
Dialogue: Talk to the man in the room to the far right! He'll help you get up there!

Original: LOCKE:It's as good as done!
Dialogue: It's as good as done!

Original: STAGE MASTER:The Impresario asked me to have you press the far right switch.
Dialogue: The Impresario asked me to have you press the far right switch.

Original: ULTROS:Phew! Rats!
Dialogue: Phew! Rats!

Original: IMPRESARIO:Disaster! If the two heroes are flattened, the opera's over! Then who'll win the girl?!
Dialogue: Disaster! If the two heroes are flattened, the opera's over! Then who'll win the girl?!

Original: LOCKE:Neither Draco nor Ralse will save Celes!
Dialogue: Neither Draco nor Ralse will save Celes!

Original: LOCKE:I, Locke, the world's premier adventurer, will save her!
Dialogue: I, Locke, the world's premier adventurer, will save her!

Original: IMPRESARIO:Aya... What awful acting!
Dialogue: Aya... What awful acting!

Original: ULTROS:Silence! You are in the presence of octopus royalty! A lowborn thug like you could never defeat me!
Dialogue: Silence! You are in the presence of octopus royalty! A lowborn thug like you could never defeat me!

Original: IMPRESARIO:Hmm... Might as well make the most of this. MUSIC!!
Dialogue: Hmm... Might as well make the most of this. MUSIC!!

Original: SETZER:I'm a man of my word, music man!
Dialogue: I'm a man of my word, music man!

Original: CELES:That's HIM...?!
Dialogue: That's HIM...?!

Original: IMPRESARIO:What a reversal! Thinking she's Locke's new queen, Maria is instead nabbed by Setzer! What fate lies in store for her? Stay tuned for Part 2!
Dialogue: What a reversal! Thinking she's Locke's new queen, Maria is instead nabbed by Setzer! What fate lies in store for her? Stay tuned for Part 2!

Original: SETZER:I'll deal with you in a minute!
Dialogue: I'll deal with you in a minute!
